## Combining Risky Asset and Risk‑Free Rate ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} set.seed(101) #| eval: true #| echo: false #| results: asis #| warning: false library(webexercises) rf <- rnorm(1, mean = 3, sd = 0.5) # risk‑free rate (%) ret_p <- rnorm(1, mean = 10, sd = 2) # expected return of risky asset (%) sd_p <- rnorm(1, mean = 20, sd = 4) # volatility of risky asset (%) w <- runif(1, 0, 1) # weight in the risky asset ``` ::: You invest **58.49%** of your funds in a risky portfolio (expected return = **11.1%**, volatility = **17.3%**) and the remainder **41.51%** in the risk‑free asset (rate = **2.84%**). ::: {.question-block}
✅ Expected return = w×ret_risky + (1−w)×Rf = **7.67**%.
::: ::: {.question-block}
✅ Since the risk‑free asset has zero volatility, the portfolio’s volatility equals w×σ_risky = **10.12**%.
:::
